description: This is no /b/Monkey Wrench/b/, but you better hope you can move like one in the future.
Using a /b/Wrench/b/, you can /6/rotate/6/ --almost-- /b/any machine/b/ by /6/right-clicking/6/ and /6/pick up/6/ --almost-- any /b/pipe/b/, /b/fluid/b/ or /b/not/b/.

You can /6/shift-right-click/6/ on a /b/machine/b/ to /6/configure/6/ the /b/output side/b/. When you're /6/holding/6/ the /b/Wrench/b/, you can /6/hover/6/ over any face of the /b/machine/b/ and you'll get a /b/grid/b/ of sorts. /6/Shift-rick-clicking/6/ on the /b/middle square/b/ will set the /b/output face/b/ to the side the /b/grid/b/ is on. Doing so to the rectangles will /6/place the output/6/ to the face /6/90/6/ degrees relative to the corner elected to allow for /6/configuration/6/ in hard to reach spaces. Finally the small /b/squares/b/ in each corner will set the output to the /b/opposite/b/ side of the grid.
Remember, you cannot /6/break/6/ the machine using the /b/Wrench/b/, it WILL /6/destroy/6/ it and you /6/wont/6/ get it back. Just use your trusty /b/Pickaxe/b/ instead.
